verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329> upon Shoshannim <WH7799>, A Psalm of David <WH1732>. Save <WH3467> me, O God <WH430>; for the waters <WH4325> are come <WH935> in unto my soul <WH5315>.

I sink <WH2883> in deep <WH4688> mire <WH3121>, where there is no standing <WH4613>: I am come <WH935> into deep <WH4615> waters <WH4325>, where the floods <WH7641> overflow <WH7857> me. deep mire: Heb. the mire of depth deep waters: Heb. depth of waters
I am weary <WH3021> of my crying <WH7121>: my throat <WH1627> is dried <WH2787>: mine eyes <WH5869> fail <WH3615> while I wait <WH3176> for my God <WH430>.

They that hate <WH8130> me without a cause <WH2600> are more <WH7231> than the hairs <WH8185> of mine head <WH7218>: they that would destroy <WH6789> me, being mine enemies <WH341> wrongfully <WH8267>, are mighty <WH6105>: then I restored <WH7725> that which I took not away <WH1497>.
O God <WH430>, thou knowest <WH3045> my foolishness <WH200>; and my sins <WH819> are not hid <WH3582> from thee. sins: Heb. guiltiness

Let not them that wait <WH6960> on thee, O Lord <WH136> GOD <WH3069> of hosts <WH6635>, be ashamed <WH954> for my sake: let not those that seek <WH1245> thee be confounded <WH3637> for my sake, O God <WH430> of Israel <WH3478>.
Because for thy sake I have borne <WH5375> reproach <WH2781>; shame <WH3639> hath covered <WH3680> my face <WH6440>.
I am become a stranger <WH2114> unto my brethren <WH251>, and an alien <WH5237> unto my mother's <WH517> children <WH1121>.
For the zeal <WH7068> of thine house <WH1004> hath eaten me up <WH398>; and the reproaches <WH2781> of them that reproached <WH2778> thee are fallen <WH5307> upon me.
When I wept <WH1058>, and chastened my soul <WH5315> with fasting <WH6685>, that was to my reproach <WH2781>.
I made <WH5414> sackcloth <WH8242> also my garment <WH3830>; and I became a proverb <WH4912> to them.
They that sit in <WH3427> the gate <WH8179> speak <WH7878> against me; and I was the song <WH5058> of the drunkards <WH8354> <WH7941>. drunkards: Heb. drinkers of strong drink

But as for me, my prayer <WH8605> is unto thee, O LORD <WH3068>, in an acceptable <WH7522> time <WH6256>: O God <WH430>, in the multitude <WH7230> of thy mercy <WH2617> hear <WH6030> me, in the truth <WH571> of thy salvation <WH3468>.
Deliver <WH5337> me out of the mire <WH2916>, and let me not sink <WH2883>: let me be delivered <WH5337> from them that hate <WH8130> me, and out of the deep <WH4615> waters <WH4325>.
Let not the waterflood <WH4325> <WH7641> overflow <WH7857> me, neither let the deep <WH4688> swallow me up <WH1104>, and let not the pit <WH875> shut <WH332> her mouth <WH6310> upon me.
Hear <WH6030> me, O LORD <WH3068>; for thy lovingkindness <WH2617> is good <WH2896>: turn <WH6437> unto me according to the multitude <WH7230> of thy tender mercies <WH7356>.
And hide <WH5641> not thy face <WH6440> from thy servant <WH5650>; for I am in trouble <WH6887>: hear <WH6030> me speedily <WH4118>. hear: Heb. make haste to hear me
Draw nigh <WH7126> unto my soul <WH5315>, and redeem <WH1350> it: deliver <WH6299> me because of mine enemies <WH341>.
Thou hast known <WH3045> my reproach <WH2781>, and my shame <WH1322>, and my dishonour <WH3639>: mine adversaries <WH6887> are all before thee.

Reproach <WH2781> hath broken <WH7665> my heart <WH3820>; and I am full of heaviness <WH5136>: and I looked <WH6960> for some to take pity <WH5110>, but there was none; and for comforters <WH5162>, but I found <WH4672> none. to take: Heb. to lament with me
They gave <WH5414> me also gall <WH7219> for my meat <WH1267>; and in my thirst <WH6772> they gave me vinegar <WH2558> to drink <WH8248>.
Let their table <WH7979> become a snare <WH6341> before <WH6440> them: and that which should have been for their welfare <WH7965>, let it become a trap <WH4170>.
Let their eyes <WH5869> be darkened <WH2821>, that they see <WH7200> not; and make their loins <WH4975> continually <WH8548> to shake <WH4571>.
Pour out <WH8210> thine indignation <WH2195> upon them, and let thy wrathful <WH2740> anger <WH639> take hold <WH5381> of them.
Let their habitation <WH2918> be desolate <WH8074>; and let none dwell <WH3427> in their tents <WH168>. their habitation: Heb. their palace let none: Heb. let there not be a dweller
For they persecute <WH7291> him whom thou hast smitten <WH5221>; and they talk <WH5608> to the grief <WH4341> of those whom thou hast wounded <WH2491>. those: Heb. thy wounded
Add <WH5414> iniquity <WH5771> unto their iniquity <WH5771>: and let them not come <WH935> into thy righteousness <WH6666>. iniquity unto: or, punishment of iniquity, etc
Let them be blotted <WH4229> out of the book <WH5612> of the living <WH2416>, and not be written <WH3789> with the righteous <WH6662>.
But I am poor <WH6041> and sorrowful <WH3510>: let thy salvation <WH3444>, O God <WH430>, set me up on high <WH7682>.
I will praise <WH1984> the name <WH8034> of God <WH430> with a song <WH7892>, and will magnify <WH1431> him with thanksgiving <WH8426>.
This also shall please <WH3190> the LORD <WH3068> better <WH3190> than an ox <WH7794> or bullock <WH6499> that hath horns <WH7160> and hoofs <WH6536>.
The humble <WH6035> shall see <WH7200> this, and be glad <WH8055>: and your heart <WH3824> shall live <WH2421> that seek <WH1875> God <WH430>. humble: or, meek
For the LORD <WH3068> heareth <WH8085> the poor <WH34>, and despiseth <WH959> not his prisoners <WH615>.
Let the heaven <WH8064> and earth <WH776> praise <WH1984> him, the seas <WH3220>, and every thing that moveth <WH7430> therein. moveth: Heb. creepeth
For God <WH430> will save <WH3467> Zion <WH6726>, and will build <WH1129> the cities <WH5892> of Judah <WH3063>: that they may dwell <WH3427> there, and have it in possession <WH3423>.
The seed <WH2233> also of his servants <WH5650> shall inherit <WH5157> it: and they that love <WH157> his name <WH8034> shall dwell <WH7931> therein.
